title: @Riot. With all those mana and item changes I think you forgot about someone.
body:
I must ask you something very important to me.
https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4ibwsJ3koVw/VwhU0x02EsI/AAAAAAAANTs/7PYZOFKY2rgKyxRDYOAFH2AcqtjHZc-Vw/s1600/chalice.jpg
https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OeB-4tVSPd8/VwhU0YGD1hI/AAAAAAAANTg/gZXWoIDeAEEzMnT0jEWzIB5GETixv6gQw/s1600/athenes.jpg

Do you even remember who builds {{item:3028}} literally every game as his rush, core item right after {{item:1056}}?
Do you know that changing {{item:3174}} into support item will affect this champion like none other?
Do you know he have no way to heal or shield (i dont think his w is a "shield" that this passive is coded for) others?
Do you know that his builds are in strange place even w/o this change?
Do you know that he is left in top 5 lowest play rates in this game for years?

If you still have no idea about what champion im talking about here's an answer:
{{champion:3}} the Forgotten

Riot said that they think recalling will be a power play for mid laners now. Refill your mana and pick up another strong component item

Tanks and bruisers get {{item:3083}} and they can refill their HP on the go.
ADC's get {{item:3508}} {{item:1053}} and they can refill their HP AND Mana.

And when they get back it won't be for a strong component item, but for a completed one because they've had resources to farm/fight for a longer period. Unless "power play" is a new term for "crippling weakness" mages are just getting fucked even harder than they are already.

If you recall 7 minutes in because you're out of mana, there goes your tower. Now you have mana, but no lane opponent to use it on! Uh oh, they just roamed bot and took that tower too.  Now time for the 5 man push mid.

;-;

Power play, my ass.

Every other class only has to recall because they don't have health or want to buy and in case of AD overlords, only to buy.
Not the forgotten AD Casters.

Yeah they will come back with a nice item, at the small cost of their outer turret...  

You can't just leave lane mid whenever you want, towers die really quickly, and are worth a lot of gold + map pressure.
Y'now, every single champion can already recall to refill their mana and pick up a strong component item, and they can generally do it when they want instead of being forced to.

Did you even try and play some champs with the new items on the PBE?

Because, between the new Tear and Meditation, you are fairly sustained mana-wise unless you carelessly spam your spells till kingdom come.

yes, and the new items change nearly nothing, instead of mages goin athenes or morellos, **every single fucking mage will now have to get tear**, as thats the only item providing sufficient mana, with most likely morellos as ich the most efficient cdr option with tear. Such varity for items, since voidstaff still is a mustbuy...
For most mages, the only thing that changes is that morellos is slightly less expensive, but they have to use that gold and then some on tear, haveing one more slot hardforced for a sprcific item, so they can vary their builts 'better'...
That's how AD Casters have worked now for ages. Jayce, Varus, and Urgot always rush mana. I think this mage update is basically going to make mages work a lot like those AD Casters.

and people wanted mana sustain options for thos champs for a long time now. 
Jayce and varus are rather unpopular, and i'd argue a reason for that is that going tear feels ankward on them but is the only real solution for their mana.
I played both of them in S5 with old ER, and i hardly play them anymore now that ER has been changed into stupid crit.
Urgot always is unpopular, but that has many reasons.

Also, heaveing a entire class with 3 mustbuy items(i really don't think anyone will not go for morellos if he already goes AA, and void always is a must) simply goes against the very idea of item diversity
AD Casters still have decent auto attacks though.

And... is that not enough?
I mean, in laning phase you farm with autoattacks, you don't use spells to last hit. You only use them in trades, which means you can 2 more trades counting mana regen, which means you'll be fine for another 5-7 minutes before recalling, but you won't because you'll recall earlier anyway to buy.

You must've never played as Syndra aganist Zeds, Yasuos, Ekkos, Talons and other bullshits that can either clear whole wave with one spell or have non-mana resource and do it in two rotations instead.

You must've never experienced having to use all your mana just to not get shoved under the tower, simply to last hit some minions.
